As of January 2022, the Paycheck Protection Program (PPP), which was designed to assist small businesses, self-employed workers, sole proprietors and other small businesses to meet operating expenses during the COVID pandemic distributed $792B in PPP loans and forgave total loan of $663.9B.   Federal authorities and media have raised questions about fraud, oversight and equity in loan approval.  This project will examine Paycheck Protection Program (PPP) data from the Small Business Administration to identify potential cases of fraud and evaluate the demographics of individuals who received the loans. The project applied big data techniques including machine learning (ML) to evaluate the PPP dataset.  The software stack was used to include Amazon Web Service cloud, Databricks, Hadoop Distributed File Storage, PySpark, SQL queries and other Python libraries such as Matplotlib, seaborn, plotly for visualization and Pandas, Numpy for data frame operations.
